revised_title: An Account of the Gymnotus Electricus: The Electric Eel
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of the Gymnotus Electricus, also known as the electric eel, focusing on its unique electric organ and its anatomy. The electric organ is responsible for the fish's electric shocks, which are produced by specialized cells called electrocytes. The author describes the structure and function of these organs, as well as their connection to the fish's nervous system.
